head.title: How to Break Our Oil Dependence

hedline.hl1: How to Break Our Oil Dependence

block.p: Anybody reading Gov. Brian Schweitzer's article might conclude that synfuels from coal are the answer to global warming. Nothing could be further from the truth.
Anybody reading Gov. Brian Schweitzer's article might conclude that synfuels from coal are the answer to global warming. Nothing could be further from the truth.
Burning synthetic gasoline made from coal releases as much carbon dioxide into the atmosphere as burning the real thing.

Moreover, the process for making synfuel or hydrogen from coal produces carbon dioxide, which is vented into the atmosphere. Nobody has yet figured a safe place to put it where it will stay put for long enough.
The big investment in coal infrastructure is locking us into an energy policy that will be an environmental catastrophe, both locally and globally.
The writer, a geophysical sciences professor at the University of Chicago, was a lead author of the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change Third Assessment Report.
